arabicText: وَهُوَ ٱلَّذِى خَلَقَ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضَ فِى سِتَّةِ أَيَّامٍۢ وَكَانَ عَرْشُهُۥ عَلَى ٱلْمَآءِ لِيَبْلُوَكُمْ أَيُّكُمْ أَحْسَنُ عَمَلًۭا ۗ وَلَئِن قُلْتَ إِنَّكُم مَّبْعُوثُونَ مِنۢ بَعْدِ ٱلْمَوْتِ لَيَقُولَنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوٓا۟ إِنْ هَـٰذَآ إِلَّا سِحْرٌۭ مُّبِينٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
. And	 there	 is	 none	 that	 walks	 upon	 the	
earth	whose	sustenance	does	not	depend	
on	the	mercy	of	Allah - He	knows	where	it	
shall	stay	and	where	it	shall	be	deposited;	
everything	is	in	a	clearly	explaining	Book
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 zameen	 par	 chalne wāla	 koi	 aisa	
nahiñ	jis	 ka	 rizq	Allāh	 ke	zimma-e-karam	
par	na	ho	aur	jānta	hai	ke	kahāñ	thahrega
aur	 kahāñ	 supurd	 hoga	 sab	 kuchh	 ek	 sāf	
bayān	karne	wāli	Kitāb	meiñ	hai

arabicText: وَهُوَ ٱلَّذِى خَلَقَ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضَ فِى سِتَّةِ أَيَّامٍۢ وَكَانَ عَرْشُهُۥ عَلَى ٱلْمَآءِ لِيَبْلُوَكُمْ أَيُّكُمْ أَحْسَنُ عَمَلًۭا ۗ وَلَئِن قُلْتَ إِنَّكُم مَّبْعُوثُونَ مِنۢ بَعْدِ ٱلْمَوْتِ لَيَقُولَنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوٓا۟ إِنْ هَـٰذَآ إِلَّا سِحْرٌۭ مُّبِينٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
And	it	is	He	Who	created	the	heavens	and	
the	earth	in	six	days	- and	His	Throne	was	
upon	 the	 water	 - so	 that	 He	 might	 test	
you,	 as	 to	 who	 among	 you	 have	 the	 best	
deeds	 *;	 and	 if	 you	 (O	 dear	 Prophet	
Muhammad - peace	and	blessings	be	upon	
him)	say,	“Indeed	you	will	be	raised	again	
after	 death”,	 the	 disbelievers	 will	 surely	
say,	 “This	 is	 nothing	 but	 clear	 magic.”	(*	
The	creation	of	all	things	is	in	order	to	test	
mankind.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	wohi	 hai	jis	 ne	 āsmānoñ	 aur	 zameen	
ko	 chhe	 din	 meiñ	 banāyā	 aur	 us	 ka	 ‘arsh	
pāni	par	thā	ke	tumheiñ	āzmāye	tum	meiñ	
kis ka	 kām	 achchā	 hai	 aur	 agar	 tum	
farmāo	 ke	 be-shak	 tum	 marne	 ke	 b’ād	
uthāye	jāoge	 to	 kāfir	 zaroor	 kaheñge	 yeh	
to	nahiñ	magar	khulā	jādu

arabicText: وَلَئِنْ أَخَّرْنَا عَنْهُمُ ٱلْعَذَابَ إِلَىٰٓ أُمَّةٍۢ مَّعْدُودَةٍۢ لَّيَقُولُنَّ مَا يَحْبِسُهُۥٓ ۗ أَلَا يَوْمَ يَأْتِيهِمْ لَيْسَ مَصْرُوفًا عَنْهُمْ وَحَاقَ بِهِم مَّا كَانُوا۟ بِهِۦ يَسْتَهْزِءُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	if	We	postpone	the	punishment	upon	
them	for	a	specified	time,	they	will	surely	
say,	 “What	 holds	 it	 back?”	 Pay	 heed!	 On	
the	day	when	it	comes	upon	 them,	it	will	
not	 be	 averted	 from	 them,	 and	 the	 very	
punishment	 they	 mocked	 at	 will	
encompass	them
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	agar	ham	un	se	‘aƶāb	kuchh		ginti ki
muddat	 tak	 hatā	 deiñ	 to	 zaroor	 kaheñge	
kis	chiz	ne	usey	rokā	hai	sun	lo	jis	din un	
par	āyega	un	se	pherā	na	jāega	aur	unheiñ	
gher	legā	wohi	‘aƶāb	jis	ki	hañsi	udāte	the.

arabicText: وَلَئِنْ أَذَقْنَا ٱلْإِنسَـٰنَ مِنَّا رَحْمَةًۭ ثُمَّ نَزَعْنَـٰهَا مِنْهُ إِنَّهُۥ لَيَـُٔوسٌۭ كَفُورٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
And	 if	We	 bestow	 man	 the	 enjoyment	 of	
some	mercy	from	Us	and	later	withdraw	it	
from	 him;	 surely	 he	 is	 most	 despairing,	
ungrateful.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 agar	 ham	 ādmi	 ko	 apni	 kisi	 raḥmat				
ka	 mazah	 deñ	 phir	 usey	 us	 se	 chin	 leñ	
zaroor	woh	badā	na	ummid	na	shukrā	hai

arabicText: وَلَئِنْ أَذَقْنَـٰهُ نَعْمَآءَ بَعْدَ ضَرَّآءَ مَسَّتْهُ لَيَقُولَنَّ ذَهَبَ ٱلسَّيِّـَٔاتُ عَنِّىٓ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ لَفَرِحٌۭ فَخُورٌ
englishTranslationText:
And	if	We	bestow	upon	him	the	enjoyment	of	a	favour	after	a	misfortune	that	had	befallen	him,	
he	will	surely	say,	“The	evils	have	gone	away	from	me”;	indeed	he	is	jubilant,	boastful.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	agar	ham	usey	ni’amat	ka	mazah	deñ	
us	 musibat	 ke	 b’ad	 jo	 usey	 pahuñchi	 to	
zaroor	 kahegā	 ke	 burāiyān	mujh	 se	 door	 huyiñ	 be-shak	 	 woh	 khush	 hone	 wāla	 badāi	mārne		
wāla	hai

arabicText: إِلَّا ٱلَّذِينَ صَبَرُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ لَهُم مَّغْفِرَةٌۭ وَأَجْرٌۭ كَبِيرٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
And	if	We	bestow	upon	him	the	enjoyment	of	a	favour	after	a	misfortune	that	had	befallen	him,	
he	will	surely	say,	“The	evils	have	gone	away	from	me”;	indeed	he	is	jubilant,	boastful.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Except	 those	who	patiently	endured	and	did	good	deeds;	 for	 them	is	 forgiveness,	and	a	great	
reward.

arabicText: فَلَعَلَّكَ تَارِكٌۢ بَعْضَ مَا يُوحَىٰٓ إِلَيْكَ وَضَآئِقٌۢ بِهِۦ صَدْرُكَ أَن يَقُولُوا۟ لَوْلَآ أُنزِلَ عَلَيْهِ كَنزٌ أَوْ جَآءَ مَعَهُۥ مَلَكٌ ۚ إِنَّمَآ أَنتَ نَذِيرٌۭ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَىْءٍۢ وَكِيلٌ
englishTranslationText:
So	will	you	 forsake	part	of	what	is	divinely	revealed	to	you	and	be	disheartened	because	they	
say,	“Why	has	not	a	treasure	been	sent	down	along	with	him?”, or	“An	angel	should	have	come	
with	him”?	You	are	purely	a	Herald	of	Warning	*;	and	Allah is	 the	Guardian	over	all	 things.	(*	
Therefore	do	not	grieve	over	their	sayings.)
romanUrduTranslationText: . Magar	jinhoñ	ne	sabr	kiya	aur	achche	kām	kiye	un	ke	liye	bakhshish	aur	badā	sawāb	hai.

arabicText: أَمْ يَقُولُونَ افْتَرَاهُ ۖ قُلْ فَأْتُوا۟ بِعَشْرِ سُوَرٍۢ مِّثْلِهِۦ مُفْتَرَيَـٰتٍۢ وَٱدْعُوا۟ مَنِ ٱسْتَطَعْتُم مِّن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ إِن كُنتُمْ صَـٰدِقِينَ
englishTranslationText:
What!	 They	 dare	 say	 that	 “He	 has	
fabricated it”?	 Say	 “Therefore	 bring	 ten	
fabricated	chapters	like	these,	and	call	on	
everyone	you	can	other	 than	Allah,	if	you	
are	truthful.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	kya	jo	whi	tumhāri	taraf	hoti	hai	us	meiñ	se	kuch	tum	chhord	doge	aur	us	par	dil	tang	hoge	is	
binā	par	ke	woh	kahte	haiñ	in	ke	sāth	koi	khazāna	kyuñ	na	utrā	ya	in	ke	sāth	koi	Farishtā	āatā,
tum	to	dar	sunāne	wāle	ho	aur	Allāh	har	cheez	par	muhāfiż	hai.

arabicText: فَإِلَّمْ يَسْتَجِيبُوا۟ لَكُمْ فَٱعْلَمُوٓا۟ أَنَّمَآ أُنزِلَ بِعِلْمِ ٱللَّهِ وَأَن لَّآ إِلَـٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ ۖ فَهَلْ أَنتُم مُّسْلِمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
So	O	Muslims,	if	 they	are	 unable	 to	 reply	
to	this	challenge	of	yours,	then	know	well	
that	 it	 is	 sent	 down	 only	 with	 the	
knowledge	of	Allah;	and	 that	except	Him,	
there	 is	 no	 real	 God;	 so	 will	 you	 now	
accept?
romanUrduTranslationText:
. To	aey	Musalmānoñ!	Agar	woh	tumhāri	is	
bāt	ka	jawāb	na	de	sakeñ	 to	samajh	lo	ke	
woh	Allāh	ke	‘ilm	hi	se	utrā	hai	aur	yeh	ke	
us	 ke	 siwā	 koi	 sachchā	m’abood	 nahiñ	 to	
kya	ab	tum	mānoge?

arabicText: مَن كَانَ يُرِيدُ ٱلْحَيَوٰةَ ٱلدُّنْيَا وَزِينَتَهَا نُوَفِّ إِلَيْهِمْ أَعْمَـٰلَهُمْ فِيهَا وَهُمْ فِيهَا لَا يُبْخَسُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Whoever	desires	the	life	of	this	world	and	
its	 comforts,	 We	 shall	 give	 them	 the	 full	
reward	for	their	deeds	in	it,	and	not	make	
any	reduction	in	it.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jo	dunyā	ki	zindagi	aur	āarāish	chahtā	ho	
ham	 is	 meiñ	 un	 ka	 poorā	 phal	 de	 deñ	 ge	
aur	is	meiñ	kami	na	deñ	ge.

arabicText: أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ ٱلَّذِينَ لَيْسَ لَهُمْ فِى ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ إِلَّا ٱلنَّارُ ۖ وَحَبِطَ مَا صَنَعُوا۟ فِيهَا وَبَـٰطِلٌۭ مَّا كَانُوا۟ يَعْمَلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
. These	 are	 the	 ones	 for	 whom	 there	 is	
nothing	 in	 the	 Hereafter	 except	 the	 fire;	
and	 all	 that	 they	 did	 there	 has	 gone	 to	
waste	and	all	their	deeds	are	destroyed.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Yeh	 haiñ	 woh	 jin	 ke	 liye	 āakhirat	 meiñ	
kuchh	nahiñ	magar	āag	aur	akārat	gayā	jo	
kuchh	 h	 wahāñ	 karte	 the	 aur	 nābood	
(barbād)	huye	jo	un	ke	‘amal	the	
.

arabicText: أَفَمَن كَانَ عَلَىٰ بَيِّنَةٍۢ مِّن رَّبِّهِۦ وَيَتْلُوهُ شَاهِدٌۭ مِّنْهُ وَمِن قَبْلِهِۦ كِتَـٰبُ مُوسَىٰٓ إِمَامًۭا وَرَحْمَةً ۚ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ يُؤْمِنُونَ بِهِۦ ۚ وَمَن يَكْفُرْ بِهِۦ مِنَ ٱلْأَحْزَابِ فَٱلنَّارُ مَوْعِدُهُۥ ۚ فَلَا تَكُ فِى مِرْيَةٍۢ مِّنْهُ ۚ إِنَّهُ ٱلْحَقُّ مِن رَّبِّكَ وَلَـٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَ ٱلنَّاسِ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ
englishTranslationText:
So	is	 (equal	 to)	 the	 one	 who	is	 upon	 the	
clear	 proof	 from	 his	 Lord,	 and	 comes	 a	
witness	 upon	it	 from	Allah,	 and	 before	it	
the	Book	of	Moosa,	a	leader	and	a	mercy;	
they	accept	faith	in	it;	and	whoever	denies	
it	 from	 all	 the	 groups,	 then	 the	 fire	 is	
promised	 for	 him;	 so	 O	 listener,	 do	 not	
have	any	doubt	concerning	it;	indeed	it	is	
the	truth	from	your	Lord;	but	most	people
do	not	believe.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	kya	woh	jo	apne	Rab	ki	taraf	se	roshan	
dalil	 par	 ho	 aur	 us	 par	 Allāh	 ki	 taraf	 se	
gawāh	āaye	aur	us	se	pehle	Mūsā ki	Kitāb	
peshwā	aur	Raḥmat	woh	us	par	Imān	late	
haiñ	 aur	 jo	is	 ka	munkir	 ho	 sāre	 girohoñ	
meiñ	to	āag	us	ka	w’adā	hai	to	aey	sun	ne	
wāle!	 tujhe	kuchh	h	us	meiñ	shak	na	ho	be-shak		woh	haq	hai	 tere	rab	ki	 taraf	se	lekin	bahut	
ādmi	Imān	nahiñ	rakhte.

arabicText: وَمَنْ أَظْلَمُ مِمَّنِ ٱفْتَرَىٰ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ كَذِبًا ۚ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ يُعْرَضُونَ عَلَىٰ رَبِّهِمْ وَيَقُولُ ٱلْأَشْهَـٰدُ هَـٰٓؤُلَآءِ ٱلَّذِينَ كَذَبُوا۟ عَلَىٰ رَبِّهِمْ ۚ أَلَا لَعْنَةُ ٱللَّهِ عَلَى ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	who	is	more	unjust	than	the	one	who	fabricates	a	lie	against	Allah?	They	will	be	presented	
before	 their	 Lord,	and	 the	witnesses	will	 say,	 “It	is	 these	who	lied	 concerning	 their	 Lord;	 the	
curse	of	Allah be	upon	the	unjust!”	(*	The	Prophets	and	angels.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	us	se	badh	kar	zālim	kaun	jo	Allāh	par	jhoot	bāñdhe? Woh	apne	Rab	ke	huzoor	pesh	kiye	
jāyeñ	ge	aur	gawāh	kaheñ	ge	yeh	haiñ	jinhoñ	ne	apne	rab	par	jhoot	bolā	tha	arey' Zālimoñ	par	
Khudā	ki	l’anat

arabicText: ٱلَّذِينَ يَصُدُّونَ عَن سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ وَيَبْغُونَهَا عِوَجًۭا وَهُم بِٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ هُمْ كَـٰفِرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Those	who	prevent	from	the	way	of	Allah and	wish	deviation	in	it;	and it	is	they	who	disbelieve	
in	the	Hereafter.
romanUrduTranslationText: Jo	Allāh	ki	rāh	se	rokte haiñ	aur	is	meiñ	kaji	chāhte	haiñ	aur	wohi	āakhirat	ke	munkir	haiñ.

arabicText: أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ لَمْ يَكُونُوا۟ مُعْجِزِينَ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَمَا كَانَ لَهُم مِّن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ مِنْ أَوْلِيَآءَ ۘ يُضَـٰعَفُ لَهُمُ ٱلْعَذَابُ ۚ مَا كَانُوا۟ يَسْتَطِيعُونَ ٱلسَّمْعَ وَمَا كَانُوا۟ يُبْصِرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
They	 will	 not	 be	 able	 to	 escape	 in	 the	
earth,	 nor	 do	 they	 have	 any	 protecting	
friends	apart	 from	Allah;	 they	will	have	
punishment	 upon	 punishment;	 they	
were	unable	 to	hear,	nor	used	 to	see.	(*	
Hear	or	see	the	truth.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Woh	 thakāne	 wāle	 nahiñ	 zameen	 meiñ	
aur	 na	Allāh	 se	judā	 un	 ke	 koi	 himāyati	
unheiñ	‘aƶāb	par	‘aƶāb	hoga	woh	na	sun	
sakte	the	na	dekhte

arabicText: أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ ٱلَّذِينَ خَسِرُوٓا۟ أَنفُسَهُمْ وَضَلَّ عَنْهُم مَّا كَانُوا۟ يَفْتَرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
It	is	 they	who	 put	 their	 souls	into	 ruin,	
and	 they	 lost	 all	 that	 they	 used	 to	
fabricate.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Wohi	haiñ	jinhoñ	ne	apni	jān	ghāte	meiñ	
dāli	aur	 un	 se	 khoi	gayiñ	jo	 bateñ	jodte	
the

arabicText: لَا جَرَمَ أَنَّهُمْ فِى ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ هُمُ ٱلْأَخْسَرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
They	will	be,	unnecessarily,	the	greatest	
losers	in	the	Hereafter.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Khwāh	 na-khwāh	 (yaqeenan)	 wohi	
Ākhirat meiñ	 sab	 se	 ziyādah	 nuqsān	
meiñ	haiñ

arabicText: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ وَأَخْبَتُوٓا۟ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِمْ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ أَصْحَـٰبُ ٱلْجَنَّةِ ۖ هُمْ فِيهَا خَـٰلِدُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	 those	 who	 believed	 and	
performed	 good	 deeds	 and	 directed	
themselves	 towards	 their	 Lord	 - they	
are	 the	 people	 of	 Paradise;	 they	 will	
abide	in	it	forever.
romanUrduTranslationText:
. Be-shak	 	 jo	 Imān	 lāye	 aur	 achche	 kām	
kiye	aur	apne Rab	ki	taraf	ruju’	lāye	woh	
Jannat	wāle	haiñ	woh	us	meiñ	hamesha	
raheñge.

arabicText: ۞ مَثَلُ ٱلْفَرِيقَيْنِ كَٱلْأَعْمَىٰ وَٱلْأَصَمِّ وَٱلْبَصِيرِ وَٱلسَّمِيعِ ۚ هَلْ يَسْتَوِيَانِ مَثَلًا ۚ أَفَلَا تَذَكَّرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
The	 example	 of	 the	 two	 groups	 is	 like	
one	being	blind	and	deaf,	and	 the	other	
seeing	 and	 hearing;	 are	 they	 equal	 in	
condition?	So	do	you	not	ponder?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Donoñ	 fareeq	 kā	 hāl	 aisa	 hai	 jaise	 ek	
andhā	aur	 behrā	aur	 doosrā	 dekhta	aur	
suntā	kya	in	donoñ	ka	hāl	eksā	hai	to	kya	
tum	dhiyān	nahiñ	karte

arabicText: وَلَقَدْ أَرْسَلْنَا نُوحًا إِلَىٰ قَوْمِهِۦٓ إِنِّى لَكُمْ نَذِيرٌۭ مُّبِينٌ
englishTranslationText:
And	indeed	We	sent	Nooh	to	his	people	
that,	“Indeed	I	am	for	you	a	clear	Herald	
of	Warning.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	be-shak		ham	ne	Nūh ko	us	ki	qaum	
ki	taraf bhejā	ke	maiñ	tumhāre	liye	sarih	
dar	sunāne	wāla	hooñ

arabicText: أَن لَّا تَعْبُدُوٓا۟ إِلَّا ٱللَّهَ ۖ إِنِّىٓ أَخَافُ عَلَيْكُمْ عَذَابَ يَوْمٍ أَلِيمٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
“That	 you	 must	 worship	 none	 except	
Allah;	 indeed	 I	 fear	 the	 punishment	 of	
the	calamitous	day	upon	you.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Ke	Allāh	ke	siwā	kisi	ko	na	poojo	be-shak		maiñ	tum	par	ek	musibat	wāle	din	ke	‘aƶāb	se	dartā	
hooñ

arabicText: فَقَالَ ٱلْمَلَأُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ مِن قَوْمِهِۦ مَا نَرَىٰكَ إِلَّا بَشَرًۭا مِّثْلَنَا وَمَا نَرَىٰكَ ٱتَّبَعَكَ إِلَّا ٱلَّذِينَ هُمْ أَرَاذِلُنَا بَادِىَ ٱلرَّأْىِ وَمَا نَرَىٰ لَكُمْ عَلَيْنَا مِن فَضْلٍۭ بَلْ نَظُنُّكُمْ كَـٰذِبِينَ
englishTranslationText:
The	chiefs	of	his	people,	who	were	disbelievers,	said,	“We	see	that	you	are	just	a	mortal	like	us,	
and	we	do	not	see	anyone	following	you	except	the	most	lowly	among	us,	without	insight;	and
we	do	not	find	any	merit	in	you	above	us	- in	fact,	we	consider	you	liars.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	us	ki	qaum	ke	sardār	jo	kāfir	huye	the	bole	ham	to	tumheiñ	apne	hi	jaisa	ādmi	dekhte heiñ	
aur	ham	nahiñ	dekhte	ke	tumhāri	pairwi	kisi	ne	ki	ho	magar	hamāre	kaminoñ	ne	sar-sari	nażar	
se	aur	ham	 tum	meiñ	apne	ūpar	koi	badāi	nahiñ	pāte	balke	ham	 tumheiñ	jhootā	khayāl	karte	
haiñ

arabicText: قَالَ يَـٰقَوْمِ أَرَءَيْتُمْ إِن كُنتُ عَلَىٰ بَيِّنَةٍۢ مِّن رَّبِّى وَءَاتَىٰنِى رَحْمَةًۭ مِّنْ عِندِهِۦ فَعُمِّيَتْ عَلَيْكُمْ أَنُلْزِمُكُمُوهَا وَأَنتُمْ لَهَا كَـٰرِهُونَ
englishTranslationText:
He	said,	“O	my	people!	What	is	your	opinion	- if	I	am	on	a	clear	proof	from	my	Lord	and	He	has	
bestowed	mercy	upon	me	 from	Him,	so	you	remained	blind	towards	it;	shall	we	 force	it	upon	
you	although	you	dislike	it?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Bolā	aey	meri	qaum!	Bhalā	batāo	to	agar	maiñ	apne	Rab	ki	taraf	se	roshan	dalil	par	huñ	aur	us	
ne	 mujhe	 apne	 pās	 se	 raḥmat bakhshi	 to	 tum	 us	 se	 andhe	 rahe	 kya	 ham	 usey	 tumhāre	 gale	
chapet	deiñ	aur	tum	bezār	ho

arabicText: وَيَـٰقَوْمِ لَآ أَسْـَٔلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مَالًا ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِىَ إِلَّا عَلَى ٱللَّهِ ۚ وَمَآ أَنَا۠ بِطَارِدِ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوٓا۟ ۚ إِنَّهُم مُّلَـٰقُوا۟ رَبِّهِمْ وَلَـٰكِنِّىٓ أَرَىٰكُمْ قَوْمًۭا تَجْهَلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
“And	O	my	people!	I	do	not	ask	any	wealth	
from	 you	 for	 it;	 my	 reward	 is	 only	 upon	
Allah,	 and	 I	 am	 not	 going	 to	 repel	 the	
Muslims;	indeed	they	will	meet	their	Lord,	
but	 I	 find	 you	 people	 completely	
ignorant.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 aey	 qaum' Maiñ tum	 se	 kuchh	is	 par	
māl	nahiñ	māñgtā	merā	ajr	to	Allāh	hi	par	
hai	 aur	maiñ	Musalmānoñ	 ko	 door	 karne		
wāla	nahiñ	be-shak	woh	apne	rab	se	milne	
wāle	haiñ	lekin	maiñ	tum	ko	nire	jāhil	log	
pātā	hooñ.

arabicText: وَيَـٰقَوْمِ مَن يَنصُرُنِى مِنَ ٱللَّهِ إِن طَرَدتُّهُمْ ۚ أَفَلَا تَذَكَّرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
. “And	O	my	people!	Who	would	rescue	me	
from	Allah if	 I	repel	 them?	So	do	you	not	
think?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	aey	qaum!	Mujhe	Allāh	se	kaun	bachā	
legā	 agar	maiñ	 unheiñ	 door	 karooñ	 ga	 to	
kya	tumheñ	dhyān	nahiñ

arabicText: وَلَآ أَقُولُ لَكُمْ عِندِى خَزَآئِنُ ٱللَّهِ وَلَآ أَعْلَمُ ٱلْغَيْبَ وَلَآ أَقُولُ إِنِّى مَلَكٌۭ وَلَآ أَقُولُ لِلَّذِينَ تَزْدَرِىٓ أَعْيُنُكُمْ لَن يُؤْتِيَهُمُ ٱللَّهُ خَيْرًا ۖ ٱللَّهُ أَعْلَمُ بِمَا فِىٓ أَنفُسِهِمْ  ۖ إِنِّىٓ إِذًۭا لَّمِنَ ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
“And	 I	 do	 not	 say	 to	 you,	 ‘I	 have	 the	
treasures	 of	 Allah’	 nor	 that	 ‘I	 gain	
knowledge	 of	 the	 hidden’,	 nor	 do	 I	 say	
that,	‘I	am	an	angel’	nor	do	 I	say	 to	 those	
whom	 your	 sights	 consider	 lowly,	 that	
Allah will	never	give	them	any	good;	Allah
well	knows	what	is	in	their	hearts;	if	I	do	
so,	I	would	then	be	of	the	unjust.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	maiñ	tum	se	nahiñ	kahtā	ke	mere	pās	
Allāh	ke	khazāne	haiñ	aur	na	yeh	ke	maiñ	
ghaib	jān	letā	hooñ	aur	na	yeh	kehta	hooñ	
ke	 maiñ	 Farishtā	 huñ	 aur	 maiñ	 unheñ	
nahiñ	 kahtā	jin	 ko	 tumhāri	 nigāheñ	 haqir	
samajhti	 haiñ	 ke	 hargiz	 unheiñ	 Allāh	 koi	
bhalāi	na	degā	Allāh	khoob	jānta	hai	jo	un	
ke	 diloñ	 meiñ	 hai	 aisa	 karuñ	 to	 zaroor	
maiñ	zālimoñ	meiñ	se	hoo

arabicText: قَالُوا۟ يَـٰنُوحُ قَدْ جَـٰدَلْتَنَا فَأَكْثَرْتَ جِدَٰلَنَا فَأْتِنَا بِمَا تَعِدُنَآ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ ٱلصَّـٰدِقِينَ
englishTranslationText:
They	 said,	 “O	 Nooh,	 you	 have	 disputed	
with	 us	 and	 disputed	 in	 the	 extreme,	
therefore	 bring	 upon	 us	 what	 you	
promise	us,	if	you	are	truthful.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Bole	 aey	 Nūh!	 Tum	 ham	 se	 jhagde	 aur	
bahut	 hi	 jhagde	 to	 le	 āao	 jis	 ka	 hameñ	
w’adā	de	rahe	ho	agar	sachche		ho

arabicText: قَالَ إِنَّمَا يَأْتِيكُم بِهِ ٱللَّهُ إِن شَآءَ وَمَآ أَنتُم بِمُعْجِزِينَ
englishTranslationText:
. He	said,	“Allah will	surely	bring	that	upon	
you	if	He	wills,	and	you	will	not	be	able	to	
escape.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Bolā	 woh	 to	 Allāh	 tum	 par	 lāye	 ga	 agar	
chāhe	aur	tum	thakā	na	sakoge

arabicText: وَلَا يَنفَعُكُمْ نُصْحِىٓ إِنْ أَرَدتُّ أَنْ أَنصَحَ لَكُمْ إِن كَانَ ٱللَّهُ يُرِيدُ أَن يُغْوِيَكُمْ ۚ هُوَ رَبُّكُمْ وَإِلَيْهِ تُرْجَعُونَ
englishTranslationText:
. “And	 my	 advice	 will	 not	 benefit	 you	 if	 I	
wish	 you	 good,	 when	Allah wills	 to	 keep	
you	 astray;	 He	 is	 your	 Lord	 and	 to	 Him	
you	will	return.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	tumheiñ	meri	nasihat	naf’a	na	degi	agar	maiñ	tumhārā	bhalā	chahuñ	jab	ke	Allāh	tumhāri	
gumrahi	chāhe	woh	tumhārā	Rab	hai	aur	usi	ki	taraf	phiroge

arabicText: أَمْ يَقُولُونَ ٱفْتَرَىٰهُ ۖ قُلْ إِنِ ٱفْتَرَيْتُهُۥ فَعَلَىَّ إِجْرَامِى وَأَنَا۠ بَرِىٓءٌۭ مِّمَّا تُجْرِمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
What!	They	dare	say	that,	“He	has	fabricated	it”?	Say,	“If	I	may	have	fabricated	it,	then	my	sin	is	
upon	me,	and	I	am	unconcerned with	your	sins.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kya	yeh	kahte	haiñ	inhoñ	ne	isey	apne	jee se	banā	liyā	tum	farmāo	agar	maiñ	ne	banā	liyā	hoga	
to	merā	gunāh	mujh	par	hai	aur	maiñ	tumhāre	gunāh	se	alag	hooñ

arabicText: وَأُوحِىَ إِلَىٰ نُوحٍ أَنَّهُۥ لَن يُؤْمِنَ مِن قَوْمِكَ إِلَّا مَن قَدْ ءَامَنَ فَلَا تَبْتَئِسْ بِمَا كَانُوا۟ يَفْعَلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	it	was	divinely	revealed	 to	Nooh	 that	 “None	of	 your	people	will	become	Muslims,	except	
those	who	have	already	accepted	faith	- therefore	do	not	grieve	at	what	they	do.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Nūh ko	waḥi	huyi	ke	 tumhāri	qaum	se	Musalmān	na	hoñ	ge	magar	jitne	imān	la	chuke	 to	
gham	na	kha	us	par	jo	woh	karte	haiñ

arabicText: وَٱصْنَعِ ٱلْفُلْكَ بِأَعْيُنِنَا وَوَحْيِنَا وَلَا تُخَـٰطِبْنِى فِى ٱلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوٓا۟ ۚ إِنَّهُم مُّغْرَقُونَ
englishTranslationText:
“And	build	the	ship	in	front	of	Us,	and	by	Our	command,	and	do	not	speak	to	Me	regarding	the	
unjust;	they	will	surely	be	drowned.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	kashti	banā	hamāre	sāmne	aur	hamāre	ḥukm	se	aur	zālimoñ	ke	bāre	meiñ	mujh	se	bāt	na	
karnā	woh	zaroor	dubāye	jāyeñ	ge

arabicText: وَيَصْنَعُ ٱلْفُلْكَ وَكُلَّمَا مَرَّ عَلَيْهِ مَلَأٌۭ مِّن قَوْمِهِۦ سَخِرُوا۟ مِنْهُ ۚ قَالَ إِن تَسْخَرُوا۟ مِنَّا فَإِنَّا نَسْخَرُ مِنكُمْ كَمَا تَسْخَرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	Nooh	 builds	 the	 ship;	 and	whenever	
the	 chiefs	 of	 his	 people	 passed	 by	 him,	
they	used	to	laugh	at	him;	he	said,	“If	you	
laugh	 at	 us,	then	 a	 time	 will	 come	 when	
we	will	laugh	at	you	just	as	you	laugh.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 Nūh kashti	 banātā	 hai	 aur	 jab	 us	 ki	
qaum	 ke	 sardār us	 par	 guzarte	 us	 par	
hañste	bolā	agar	tum	hampar	hañste	ho	to	
ek	waqt	ham	tum	par	hañseñ	ge	jaisā	tum	
hañste	ho

arabicText: فَسَوْفَ تَعْلَمُونَ مَن يَأْتِيهِ عَذَابٌۭ يُخْزِيهِ وَيَحِلُّ عَلَيْهِ عَذَابٌۭ مُّقِيمٌ
englishTranslationText:
“So	 now	 you	 will	 come	 to	 know	 - upon	
whom	 comes	 the	 punishment	 that	
disgraces	 him,	 and	 upon	whom	 descends	
the	punishment	that	continues	forever.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	ab	jān	jāoge	 kis	 par	ātā	 hai	woh	 ‘aƶāb	
ke	 usey	 ruswā	 kare	 aur	 utartā	 hai	 woh	
‘aƶāb	jo	hamesha	rahe

arabicText: حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا جَآءَ أَمْرُنَا وَفَارَ ٱلتَّنُّورُ قُلْنَا ٱحْمِلْ فِيهَا مِن كُلٍّۢ زَوْجَيْنِ ٱثْنَيْنِ وَأَهْلَكَ إِلَّا مَن سَبَقَ عَلَيْهِ ٱلْقَوْلُ وَمَنْ ءَامَنَ ۚ وَمَآ ءَامَنَ مَعَهُۥٓ إِلَّا قَلِيلٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
To	 the	 extent	 that	 when	 Our	 command	
came and	 the	 oven	 overflowed,	 We	 said,	
“Board	into	 the	 ship	 a	 couple	- male	 and	
female	- from	every	kind,	and	your	family	
members,	 except	 those	 upon	 whom	 the	
Word	 has	 been	 passed,	 and	 all	 other	
Muslims”;	 and	 only	 a	 few	 Muslims	 were	
with	him.	(*	Whose	fate	has	been	sealed.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Yahāñ	 tak	 ke	 jab	 hamārā	 ḥukm	 āyā	 aur	
tannoor	ublā	ham	ne	farmāyā	kashti	meiñ	
sawār	 kar	le	har	jins	meiñ	 se	ek	jodā	nar	
wa	 mādā	 aur	 jin	 par	 bāt	 pad	 chuki	 hai	
unke	 siwā	 apne	 ghar	 wāloñ	 aur	 bāqi	
Musalmānoñ	ko	aur	us	ke	sāth	Musalmān	
na	the	magar	thode

arabicText: ۞ وَقَالَ ٱرْكَبُوا۟ فِيهَا بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ مَجْر۪ىٰهَا وَمُرْسَىٰهَآ ۚ إِنَّ رَبِّى لَغَفُورٌۭ رَّحِيمٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
And	he	said,	“Board	it	- upon	Allah’s	name	
is	its	movement	 and	its	 stopping;	indeed	
my	 Lord	 is	 surely	 Oft	 Forgiving,	 Most	
Merciful.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 bolā	 is	 meiñ	 sawār	 ho	 Allāh	 ke	 nām	
par	 is	 ka	 chalnā	 aur	 is	 ka	 theharnā	 beshak	 merā	 Rab	 zaroor	 bakhsh	 ne	 wāla	
meharbān	hai.

arabicText: وَهِىَ تَجْرِى بِهِمْ فِى مَوْجٍۢ كَٱلْجِبَالِ وَنَادَىٰ نُوحٌ ٱبْنَهُۥ وَكَانَ فِى مَعْزِلٍۢ يَـٰبُنَىَّ ٱرْكَب مَّعَنَا وَلَا تَكُن مَّعَ ٱلْكَـٰفِرِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	 the	 same	 carries	 them	 amid	 waves	
like	mountains;	and	Nooh	called	out	to	his	
son	whereas	he	was	standing	apart,	“O	my	
son!	Embark	along	with	us,	and	do	not	be	
with	the	disbelievers.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 woh	 unheiñ	 liye	 jā	 rahi	 hai	 aisi	
maujoñ	meiñ	jaise	pahād	aur	Nūh ne	apne	
bete	 ko	 pukārā	 aur	 woh	 us	 se	 kināre	 thā	
aey	mere	bachche!	Hamāre	sāth	sawār	ho	
jā	aur	kāfiroñ	ke	sāth	na	ho

arabicText: وَقِيلَ يَـٰٓأَرْضُ ٱبْلَعِى مَآءَكِ وَيَـٰسَمَآءُ أَقْلِعِى وَغِيضَ ٱلْمَآءُ وَقُضِىَ ٱلْأَمْرُ وَٱسْتَوَتْ عَلَى ٱلْجُودِىِّ ۖ وَقِيلَ بُعْدًۭا لِّلْقَوْمِ ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	it	was	 commanded,	 “O	 earth,	 swallow	 your	water	 and,	O	 sky,	 stop”	- and	 the	water	was	
dried	up	and	 the	matter	was	completed	- and	 the	ship	stopped	upon	 the	mount	Al-Judi	and	it	
was	said,	“Away	with	the	unjust	nation!”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	ḥukm	farmāyā	gayā	aey	zameen	apna	pāni	nigal	le	aur	aey	āsmān	tham	jā	aur	pani	khushk	
kar	diyā	gayā	aur	kām	tamām	huā	aur	kashti	kohe	joodi	par	thehari	aur	farmāyā	gayā	ke	door	
hoñ	be	insāf	log

arabicText: وَنَادَىٰ نُوحٌۭ رَّبَّهُۥ فَقَالَ رَبِّ إِنَّ ٱبْنِى مِنْ أَهْلِى وَإِنَّ وَعْدَكَ ٱلْحَقُّ وَأَنتَ أَحْكَمُ ٱلْحَـٰكِمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	Nooh	prayed	to	his	Lord	- submitted	he,	“My	Lord!	Indeed	my	son	is	also	of	my	family,	and	
surely	Your	promise	is	true	and	You	are	the	Greatest	Ruler	of	all.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Nūh ne	apne	Rab	ko	pukārā	aur	‘arz	ki	aye	mere	rab!	merā	betā	bhi	to	merā	ghar	wāla	hai	
aur	be-shak		terā	w’adā	sachcha	hai	aur	tu sab	se	badh	kar	ḥukm	wāla
